English:
So, after all that, it was a Digimon looking for
a little exposure... Taking a shot at fame.
Chinese:
然後，就為那隻數碼寶貝
設了CD專區嗎……
Korean:
…그래서, 그 디지몬의
특설 CD 코너를 만들어 줬다는 건가…
German:
Hinter allem steckte also nur ein Digimon, das
endlich berühmt werden wollte.

English:
I kinda feel like he wasn't punished much for
the whole breaking-and-entering thing.
Chinese:
我覺得就對惡作劇犯人的處置而言，
有些太輕微了……
Korean:
장난친 범인에 대한 조치로서는
조금 지나친 관용이라는 느낌도 든다만…
German:
Ich finde, dass sein Einbruch eigentlich nicht
so ungestraft hätte bleiben dürfen.

English:
It wasn't about that at the end. We got to
the bottom of a mystery, and got to hear a
really cool up-and-coming artist!
Chinese:
才不是那樣！
我覺得悟空獸那首歌真的很棒。
Korean:
그런 게 아니에요!
전 에테몬 씨의 그 곡, 정말로 좋은 곡이라고 생각해요
German:
Darum ging es am Ende gar nicht. Wir haben ein
Rätsel gelöst und durften einen echt coolen
neuen Stern am Musikhimmel kennenlernen!

English:
Actually, I'm starting to get into his album.
That's the best part about music, there's room
for anyone to try their hand.
Chinese: 這世上可以有各式各樣的音樂……
Korean: 세상에는 그 어떤 음악이든 있어도 괜찮아요…
German:
Sein Album gefällt mir immer besser. Das ist das
Schöne an der Musik, jeder kann sich mal daran
versuchen.

English:
His music may be strange--it's definitely strange-
but it pushes the boundaries! You gotta respect
that in an artist.
Chinese:
那首歌一定能讓音樂的可能性變得更廣……
我覺得它有那樣的力量！
Korean:
그 곡은, 분명 음악의 가능성을 넓혀 줄 거예요…
그런 힘이 있다고 전 생각해요!
German:
Seine Musik ist vielleicht seltsam – okay,
definitiv seltsam –, aber sie wagt Neues! Das muss
man anerkennen.

English:
I like that. You're not just in it to help the
store grow, you're trying to expand the world
of music.
Chinese:
不只是店家的利益，
居然連音樂本身的發展都考慮到了……
Korean:
매장의 이익뿐만 아니라
음악이라는 장르 그 자체의 발전까지 생각하고 있을 줄은…
German:
Das gefällt mir. Du willst nicht nur ein Geschäft
machen, sondern musikalische Horizonte erweitern.

English: And I would expect no less.
Chinese:
不愧是唱片行的店員，
可以說是音樂愛好者的榜樣呢。
Korean:
역시 CD숍의 점원
음악 마니아의 귀감, 이라고 할 수 있겠군

English: Hehehe! No music, no life! That's my anthem!
Chinese:
No music，no life！
因為音樂是我人生的一部分！
EnglishCensored: Hehehe! Music is the soundtrack of our lives!
Korean:
NO 뮤직, NO 라이프!
음악은 인생의 일부니까요!
German:
Hihihi! Musik ist Leben! Nach dem Motto
lebe ich!

English:
Thank you so much, [p].
Now I can get back to doing what I love.
Chinese:
[p]，謝謝你。
這樣子，我就可以安心回去工作了！
Korean:
[p] 씨, 감사했습니다
이제 안심하고 일을 할 수 있겠어요!
German:
Vielen herzlichen Dank, [p].
Jetzt kann ich wieder das tun, was ich am
liebsten mag.

English:
Always feel free to drop in! This Tower Records
is like a shrine to amazing music! Hehehe!
See ya soon!
Chinese:
一定要再來商品最齊全的音樂殿堂——
淘兒唱片玩唷♪
EnglishCensored:
Always feel free to drop in! This Shibuya Records
is like a shrine to amazing music! Hehehe!
See ya soon!
Korean:
절대적인 상품을 자랑하는 음악의 전당, 타워 레코드에
꼭 다시 놀러 와 주세요♪
German:
Komm gern wieder vorbei! Shibuya Records ist wie ein
Schrein für großartige Musik! Hihihi!
Bis bald!

English:
Hmm... She really believes in that store. I hope
they know how lucky they are to have someone
like her.
Chinese:
最後竟然還大力宣傳店家……
這女孩真會推銷啊。
Korean:
마지막에 확실히 매장의 어필을 하고 가다니…
꽤나 상혼이 왕성한 아가씨로군
German:
Hm ... Sie ist wirklich von Herzen dabei. Ich
hoffe, die wissen, was sie an ihr haben.

English: Can't argue with that level of devotion. Hehehe!
Chinese:
呵呵呵……
我並不討厭露骨的推銷。
Korean:
후후후…
그 노골적인 상혼, 난 싫지 않지만 말이야
German:
Echte Begeisterung kann man nicht infrage stellen!
Hihihi!
